intro: Leptidium versicolor, commonly known as the variable bladderwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, yellowish flowers and is typically found in moist, calcareous soils. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves and produces elongated, flowering stems that bear clusters of small, inconspicuous blooms. It is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. Leptidium versicolor is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-rich, wet environments, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
